Member of NTHU Ubicomp Lab Experience Shopback software engineer intern, mobile platform team (2022.6 - 2023.6) Featured Projects ç¿’æ…£åŸè‡ªç„¶ï¼šç•¶ä»£äººé¡è¡Œç‚ºç™¾ç§‘ The Story of a Nostalgic Town - AR App This work presents through an installation, based on a landscape model of a town, accompanied by a dedicated app. Audiences can use augmented reality (AR) to view fragments of stories within the model, piecing together the narratives of the town and the residents.
An interactive installation art work with an AR App for the graduation exhibition. Tech stack used: Unity, C#, Vuforia, Figma, Firebase, Raspberry Pi, Python æ”¾è¦–å¤§è³ 2023 æ±ºé¸å…¥åœ Watch videoâœ¨ Online exhibition TechLifeProbe - Android App A system to probe how data sharing with adolescentsâ€™ parents improves their technology abuse through mobile phones
Developed an Android app for human-computer interaction research aimed at improving technology abuse. This research was published in ACM CHI 2022.
Tech stack used: Android, Kotlin, MySQL, PHP, Figma, Python
Related publication

data.example#Example: # Go to your new project folder and init git echo "# my_project" >> README.md git init # You must have one commit to use git subtree add git add README.md git commit -m "first commit" # For example, put the backend repo into the backend folder git subtree add -P backend https://github.com/path_to_backend.git main # And frontend folder git subtree add -P frontend https://github.com/path_to_frontend.git main

data.channel#Channel:
Channel æ˜¯å€‹ typed çš„ç®¡é“ï¼Œgo ç¨‹å¼å¯ä»¥é€é channel operator <- å»æ¥å—æˆ–ç™¼é€æŸå€‹å€¼ã€‚é€é channel å¯ä»¥åŒæ­¥ä¸åŒçš„ Goroutineã€‚
ç®­é ­çš„æ–¹å‘å°±ä»£è¡¨äº†è³‡æ–™çš„å‚³è¼¸æ–¹å‘ï¼š
ch := make(chan int) // create a channel for int v := 100 go func() { fmt.Println("Sending v to channel") ch <- v // Send value to the channel }() recv := <- ch // Get value from the channel fmt.Printf("recv: %v", recv) é è¨­æƒ…æ³ä¸‹ï¼Œæ¥å—èˆ‡ç™¼é€éƒ½æœƒ block ä½ï¼Œç›´åˆ°å¦ä¸€ç«¯ä¹Ÿç™¼é€æˆ–æ¥å—ï¼Œåƒæ˜¯ä»¥ä¸‹çš„ç¨‹å¼æœƒåœåœ¨ ch <- vï¼Œå› ç‚ºç¨‹å¼é‚„åœ¨ç­‰äººç™¼é€å€¼åˆ° channel ä¸­ï¼Œæœƒå‡ºç¾ deadlock éŒ¯èª¤ fatal error: all goroutines are asleep - deadlock!ï¼š
ch := make(chan int) // create a channel for int v := 100 fmt.Println("Sending v to channel") ch <- v // The code will stop here and wait for the value... recv := <- ch fmt.Printf("recv: %v", recv) channel çš„ block è¡Œç‚ºæ˜¯å¯ä»¥è¢«æ§åˆ¶çš„ï¼Œchannel å¯ä»¥å®£å‘Šæˆ buffered channelï¼Œä¸€å€‹ buffered channel è£¡çš„å€¼å¯ä»¥ä¿å­˜èµ·ä¾†ï¼Œæ¥å—ç«¯åªè¦æ‹¿çš„åˆ°å€¼å°±å¯ä»¥ç¹¼çºŒï¼Œç™¼é€ç«¯åªè¦ç™¼é€å€¼é€²å»å¾Œ channel æ²’æœ‰è¶…éå®¹é‡ä¹Ÿå¯ä»¥ç¹¼çºŒã€‚
buffered channel çš„å®¹é‡é€é make() çš„ç¬¬äºŒå€‹åƒæ•¸æŒ‡å®šï¼š
ch := make(chan int, 1) å°‡ä¸Šé¢æœƒé€ æˆ deadlock çš„ channel æ”¹æˆ buffered channel (size = 1) ï¼Œå°±å¯ä»¥æ­£å¸¸åŸ·è¡Œäº†ï¼š
ch := make(chan int, 1) // create a buffered channel for int v := 100 fmt.Println("Sending v to channel") ch <- v recv := <- ch fmt.Printf("recv: %v", recv) Close the channel Sender å¯ä»¥é€é close(channel) é€šçŸ¥ receiver ä¹‹å¾Œä¸æœƒå‚³æ±è¥¿åˆ°é€™å€‹ channel ä¸­äº†ã€‚ Receiver å¯ä»¥é€é v, ok := <- ch çš„ ok æ˜¯ false å¾—çŸ¥ channel å·²è¢«é—œé–‰ï¼Œä¹Ÿå¯ä»¥é€é for i := range c æ¥å—å€¼ï¼Œç›´åˆ° channel è¢«é—œé–‰ã€‚
